alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of heavy rains with showers over the everglades will be moving northeast into metro areas of Central Broward County. These heavy rains will be capable of producing up to another 1 inch of rainfall on top of the already 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen over this area from the last night and this mornings heavy rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Lauderdale-By- The-Sea, Lauderhill, Weston, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Dania Beach, Cooper City, Wilton Manors and Sea Ranch Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
